abstract: Stocks fall slightly amid slump in prices for raw-material producers and oil companies; investors respond to decline in manufacturing in China.
lead_paragraph: A survey of factory activity in China showed its worst reading since 2009, leading most markets down.

headline.main: Market Drifts as a Slowdown in China Arrests Early Gains
headline.print_headline: Reading on China Adds to Concerns Over Growth

snippet: A survey of factory activity in China showed its worst reading since 2009, leading most markets down.
